msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [p]

objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 2.7x2.4 (24x19.5), 1 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 5 (31) line(s) per column, 10-13 characters per line, written in Greek.

handDesc.handNote: 200-299 Original scribe with documentary hand (3 verses).

history.provenance: Excavated 1896-1907 by Bernard Grenfell and Arthur Hunt, Egypt Exploration Society at Al Bahnasā, Miṣr from a garbage dump.
Loaned to University of Oxford, Ashmolean Museum of Art and Archaeology at Oxford, England.
Moved 2001 to University of Oxford, Sackler Library at Oxford, England.

msIdentifier.msName: P. Oxy. 4497, University of Oxford, Sackler Library, Oxford, England.

sourceDesc.bibl: Cockle, W. E. H., The Oxyrhynchus Papyri, vol. 66, no. 4497, Egypt Exploration Society: London, England, 1999. OCLC 855777953.
